summary: Just rewatched Necrozma arc in full. It feels much better when watching each episode back-to-back, definitely. There are some...
body:
Just rewatched Necrozma arc in full. It feels much better when watching each episode back-to-back, definitely. There are some questions that didn’t get answered, thou I could think of it as not wanting to spoon-feed every little detail but let the viewers figure the answers out by themselves. Which I like? :D

Like, why were only Adults affected by Ultra Aura rapidly disappearing? I think it could be explained by adult’s aura being more tied to their life due to having lived longer, having experienced all sorts of life situations, thus feeling the affect of Ultra Aura’s diminish more easily. Sort of like how powerful Jedi can feel a disturbance in the force when someone dies or something bad is incoming. Or something |D It’s what I’ve kinda decided to believe to this matter, unless they somehow decide to explain it later. |D At this point I don’t count on it, but this lil headcanon of mine feels fitting to the situation? Since none of the kids nor Pokemon were affected. I feel Pokemon tend to have a more kid-like heart than adult-like, even when older, so it would explain them not being affected?

Another question is what triggered Lunala to absorb the Z-power for Ultra Guardian’s Z-Rings, and I think I have a solid explanation which really is just about reading the scene’s details. I do think that Lunala might have the ability to absorb Ultra Aura as well, but since Lunala and Solgaleo aren’t hungry of it, they don’t do it like Necrozma does. So, when Lunala notices that the kids truly want to help it out, it decides to absorb the Z-power from their Z-Rings to re-energize itself back to full health. I think it’s a pretty solid explanation? It’s shown very eager to go and help Solgaleo out.

Also, I think it’s extremely clear that throughout this arc, Solgaleo and Lunala are shown so caring of each other. They play around in the first episode, look over each other when other is down, help each other out. I felt like there was definite bond between the two, and such a cute one. I certainly hope we get to see the two again later on ♥

Then there’s Matori Matrix. Their purpose was so… odd. They acted more as a B-plot for adults to deal with back in Alola while the kids deal with the Necrozma Crisis on the other side of the Ultra Wormhole. Considering how their outcome was left open (we didn’t see them again after they were retreating from Kapu-Kokeko’s attack to their ship), I’m more and more confident this acted as an introduction to them and we’ll be seeing more of them in the next arc.

What else… I’ll write better thoughts on SM090 during the break time, but now, this is what I think of Necrozma Arc. Pretty solid, thou not perfect. I think I still prefer Ula’Ula or Aether Arc over it, but I still enjoyed it a ton and I’d def say that to me, it was a better version of what we got in the games. I did like the whole Ultra Megalopolis stuff and all, but it was so short, and the Necrozma stuff basically felt like they just switched Lusamine with Nebby and Nihilego with Necrozma. So yeh. :D

Now, time to watch Pokemarathon’s movie night!

trail.content_raw:
Just rewatched Necrozma arc in full. It feels much better when watching each episode back-to-back, definitely. There are some questions that didn’t get answered, thou I could think of it as not wanting to spoon-feed every little detail but let the viewers figure the answers out by themselves. Which I like? :D

Like, why were only Adults affected by Ultra Aura rapidly disappearing? I think it could be explained by adult’s aura being more tied to their life due to having lived longer, having experienced all sorts of life situations, thus feeling the affect of Ultra Aura’s diminish more easily. Sort of like how powerful Jedi can feel a disturbance in the force when someone dies or something bad is incoming. Or something |D It’s what I’ve kinda decided to believe to this matter, unless they somehow decide to explain it later. |D At this point I don’t count on it, but this lil headcanon of mine feels fitting to the situation? Since none of the kids nor Pokemon were affected. I feel Pokemon tend to have a more kid-like heart than adult-like, even when older, so it would explain them not being affected?

Another question is what triggered Lunala to absorb the Z-power for Ultra Guardian’s Z-Rings, and I think I have a solid explanation which really is just about reading the scene’s details. I do think that Lunala might have the ability to absorb Ultra Aura as well, but since Lunala and Solgaleo aren’t hungry of it, they don’t do it like Necrozma does. So, when Lunala notices that the kids truly want to help it out, it decides to absorb the Z-power from their Z-Rings to re-energize itself back to full health. I think it’s a pretty solid explanation? It’s shown very eager to go and help Solgaleo out.

Also, I think it’s extremely clear that throughout this arc, Solgaleo and Lunala are shown so caring of each other. They play around in the first episode, look over each other when other is down, help each other out. I felt like there was definite bond between the two, and such a cute one. I certainly hope we get to see the two again later on ♥

Then there’s Matori Matrix. Their purpose was so… odd. They acted more as a B-plot for adults to deal with back in Alola while the kids deal with the Necrozma Crisis on the other side of the Ultra Wormhole. Considering how their outcome was left open (we didn’t see them again after they were retreating from Kapu-Kokeko’s attack to their ship), I’m more and more confident this acted as an introduction to them and we’ll be seeing more of them in the next arc.

What else… I’ll write better thoughts on SM090 during the break time, but now, this is what I think of Necrozma Arc. Pretty solid, thou not perfect. I think I still prefer Ula’Ula or Aether Arc over it, but I still enjoyed it a ton and I’d def say that to me, it was a better version of what we got in the games. I did like the whole Ultra Megalopolis stuff and all, but it was so short, and the Necrozma stuff basically felt like they just switched Lusamine with Nebby and Nihilego with Necrozma. So yeh. :D

Now, time to watch Pokemarathon’s movie night!

summary:
Happy 3 year anniversary to my love @sgianaca 
I asked @dearestantoine to create this fabulous art of us together with our...
caption:
Happy 3 year anniversary to my love @sgianaca
I asked @dearestantoine to create this fabulous art of us together with our favorite Pokémon. Fun fact steve originally wanted to tell me he loved me for the first time using #blaziken and #sylveon so this is also a throwback to that moment. I love you steve to the moon and back. I’m happy I have you in my life and can’t wait to marry you next year. #anniversary #love #pokemon #pocketmonsters #emolga #instagood #gallade #flamecon #geek #nerd #instanerd #instageek
https://www.instagram.com/p/Bny3mrnFzA7/?utm_source=ig_tumblr_share&igshid=p3euie4dyywe

blog.name: occasionalmawile
blog.title: Cuteness is Justice!
blog.description: Hello, Hello! Welcome! Expect: slice of life stuff, random drawings, answers to asks and cuteness galore :3 Inbox: Open (6) | A!M: None Event: None Avatar by SnowyWinter69

summary: @maple-and-pie: 💎📿🎀 I have no Pokemon in mind but maybe an Eeveelution if you want to do it?  //I was going to go with a sylveon...
caption:
@maple-and-pie: 💎📿🎀 I have no Pokemon in mind but maybe an Eeveelution if you want to do it? 

//I was going to go with a sylveon because of the bow emoji but I didn’t like the sketch so I went with a Glaceon. You can think of the “crown” as diamonds if you want.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Feraliphlosion Feraligatr and Typhlosion fusion Fire/Water Type Ability: Flame Body/Water Absorb Stats: HP - 87, Atk - 115, Def...
caption:
Feraliphlosion

Feraligatr and Typhlosion fusion

Fire/Water Type

Ability: Flame Body/Water Absorb

Stats: HP - 87, Atk - 115, Def - 89, SpA - 90, SpD - 93, Spe - 95

The Fiery Beast Pokemon

Feraliphlosion combines the power of fire and water in its attacks.  It swims through the water, its fire constantly burning.  Its large size can be very useful for attacking its opponents. 

Request for @yveltaltokisaki. I hope you like it!

title: Tangrowth - 465
body:
It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

- Pokemon Diamond, Pearl, X, Omega Ruby

summary: This is meant to be part of a set of four Bad Anime Moms that I haven’t gotten around to finishing for Reasons, but I feel it’s...
caption:
This is meant to be part of a set of four Bad Anime Moms that I haven’t gotten around to finishing for Reasons, but I feel it’s necessary to make my feelings on Lusamine in particular clear:

She’s the fuckin’ best antagonist in Pokemon, for having the most broken, human kind of rationale to her worst acts, genuine depth and texture to her character and tragedy, beauty to how she recognizes her faults in USUM only, granted, and how badly she wants to try to put her life back together, and for being the most goddamn stylish Pokevillain full stop.

So to be super duper clear: fuck off antis. t ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) t
